text: Good morning guys, it seems that this is a new one, I got this package size error. Do we have limitations on this?
I just added an extra library to the ones I already had
<@U05GWRCQ23B> last time this happened to me it was because I accidentally had `@HubSpot/cli` in `dependencies` instead of a `devDependencies`
I just checked, but it is as devDependencies
do you have a ton of packages installed? I have a bunch and need to cut down, it would be nice to know the limit (I think I have it written down somewhere...)

I don’t think there are many, the normal ones for a react project, a component library, tailwind, a library to control videos, and now one to manage pdfs, nothing more than that. But yes, it would be ideal to know the limit, I would not like to have to remove a library due to this limitation but if necessary I need to know to do the refactor.

And the bad thing I see with this is that I know that from now on I will not be able to use any extra libraries.
I have way more packages installed so it might be something else
I have about 50 installed (and need to remove a bunch, not sure how that go so out of hand)
Depends on the libraries. Some node packages include binaries, especially ones for manipulating images and PDFs. What packages are you using <@U05GWRCQ23B> can you paste your package.json?
does this kind of thing exist on the react side yet? `{% if is_in_page_editor %}`? <@U04DLJH3W94> can you add this or can I use `hubl_data.hubl.html`?
+1 this would be a nice to have
Should be able to use that in hublData, yes
ok, thanks, I'll give that a try
a hook would be nice to have though :slightly_smiling_face:
I’m a bit confused as to what your `fields.tsx` file does in this example. Do you have a full snippet?

am I crazy or did the github "cms-react" repo have a `version` field in the meta properties of some of the modules? Is that a thing? I would love to be able to update a module but temporarily keep the old version around
